11// Based on the WAV file format documentation at
12// https://ccrma.stanford.edu/courses/422/projects/WaveFormat/ and
13// http://www-mmsp.ece.mcgill.ca/Documents/AudioFormats/WAVE/WAVE.html
14
15#include "common_audio/wav_header.h"
16
17#include <cstring>
18#include <limits>
19#include <string>
20
21#include "rtc_base/checks.h"
22#include "rtc_base/logging.h"
23#include "rtc_base/sanitizer.h"
24#include "rtc_base/system/arch.h"

26namespace webrtc {
27namespace {
28
29#ifndef WEBRTC_ARCH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
30#error "Code not working properly for big endian platforms."
31#endif
32
33#pragma pack(2)
34struct ChunkHeader {
35 uint32_t ID;
36 uint32_t Size;
37};
38static_assert(sizeof(ChunkHeader) == 8, "ChunkHeader size");
39
40#pragma pack(2)
41struct RiffHeader {
42 ChunkHeader header;
43 uint32_t Format;
44};
45static_assert(sizeof(RiffHeader) == sizeof(ChunkHeader) + 4, "RiffHeader size");
46
47// We can't nest this definition in WavHeader, because VS2013 gives an error
48// on sizeof(WavHeader::fmt): "error C2070: 'unknown': illegal sizeof operand".
49#pragma pack(2)
50struct FmtPcmSubchunk {
51 ChunkHeader header;
52 uint16_t AudioFormat;
53 uint16_t NumChannels;
54 uint32_t SampleRate;
55 uint32_t ByteRate;
56 uint16_t BlockAlign;
57 uint16_t BitsPerSample;
58};
59static_assert(sizeof(FmtPcmSubchunk) == 24, "FmtPcmSubchunk size");
60const uint32_t kFmtPcmSubchunkSize =
61 sizeof(FmtPcmSubchunk) - sizeof(ChunkHeader);
62
63// Pack struct to avoid additional padding bytes.
64#pragma pack(2)
65struct FmtIeeeFloatSubchunk {
66 ChunkHeader header;
67 uint16_t AudioFormat;
68 uint16_t NumChannels;
69 uint32_t SampleRate;
70 uint32_t ByteRate;
71 uint16_t BlockAlign;
72 uint16_t BitsPerSample;
73 uint16_t ExtensionSize;
74};
75static_assert(sizeof(FmtIeeeFloatSubchunk) == 26, "FmtIeeeFloatSubchunk size");
76const uint32_t kFmtIeeeFloatSubchunkSize =
77 sizeof(FmtIeeeFloatSubchunk) - sizeof(ChunkHeader);
78
79// Simple PCM wav header. It does not include chunks that are not essential to
80// read audio samples.
81#pragma pack(2)
82struct WavHeaderPcm {
83 WavHeaderPcm(const WavHeaderPcm&) = default;
84 WavHeaderPcm& operator=(const WavHeaderPcm&) = default;
85 RiffHeader riff;
86 FmtPcmSubchunk fmt;
87 struct {
88 ChunkHeader header;
89 } data;
90};
91static_assert(sizeof(WavHeaderPcm) == kPcmWavHeaderSize,
92 "no padding in header");
93
94// IEEE Float Wav header, includes extra chunks necessary for proper non-PCM
95// WAV implementation.
96#pragma pack(2)
97struct WavHeaderIeeeFloat {
98 WavHeaderIeeeFloat(const WavHeaderIeeeFloat&) = default;
99 WavHeaderIeeeFloat& operator=(const WavHeaderIeeeFloat&) = default;
100 RiffHeader riff;
101 FmtIeeeFloatSubchunk fmt;
102 struct {
103 ChunkHeader header;
104 uint32_t SampleLength;
105 } fact;
106 struct {
107 ChunkHeader header;
108 } data;
109};
110static_assert(sizeof(WavHeaderIeeeFloat) == kIeeeFloatWavHeaderSize,
111 "no padding in header");
112
113uint32_t PackFourCC(char a, char b, char c, char d) {
114 uint32_t packed_value =
115 static_cast<uint32_t>(a) | static_cast<uint32_t>(b) << 8 |
116 static_cast<uint32_t>(c) << 16 | static_cast<uint32_t>(d) << 24;
117 return packed_value;
118}
119
120std::string ReadFourCC(uint32_t x) {
121 return std::string(reinterpret_cast<char*>(&x), 4);
122}
123
124uint16_t MapWavFormatToHeaderField(WavFormat format) {
125 switch (format) {
126 case WavFormat::kWavFormatPcm:
127 return 1;
128 case WavFormat::kWavFormatIeeeFloat:
129 return 3;
130 case WavFormat::kWavFormatALaw:
131 return 6;
132 case WavFormat::kWavFormatMuLaw:
133 return 7;
134 }
135 RTC_CHECK_NOTREACHED();
136}
137
138WavFormat MapHeaderFieldToWavFormat(uint16_t format_header_value) {
139 if (format_header_value == 1) {
140 return WavFormat::kWavFormatPcm;
141 }
142 if (format_header_value == 3) {
143 return WavFormat::kWavFormatIeeeFloat;
144 }
145
146 RTC_CHECK(false) << "Unsupported WAV format";
147}
148
149uint32_t RiffChunkSize(size_t bytes_in_payload, size_t header_size) {
150 return static_cast<uint32_t>(bytes_in_payload + header_size -
151 sizeof(ChunkHeader));
152}
153
154uint32_t ByteRate(size_t num_channels,
155 int sample_rate,
156 size_t bytes_per_sample) {
157 return static_cast<uint32_t>(num_channels * sample_rate * bytes_per_sample);
158}
159
160uint16_t BlockAlign(size_t num_channels, size_t bytes_per_sample) {
161 return static_cast<uint16_t>(num_channels * bytes_per_sample);
162}
163
164// Finds a chunk having the sought ID. If found, then |readable| points to the
165// first byte of the sought chunk data. If not found, the end of the file is
166// reached.
167bool FindWaveChunk(ChunkHeader* chunk_header,
168 WavHeaderReader* readable,
169 const std::string sought_chunk_id) {
170 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(sought_chunk_id.size(), 4);
171 while (true) {
172 if (readable->Read(chunk_header, sizeof(*chunk_header)) !=
173 sizeof(*chunk_header))
174 return false; // EOF.
175 if (ReadFourCC(chunk_header->ID) == sought_chunk_id)
176 return true; // Sought chunk found.
177 // Ignore current chunk by skipping its payload.
178 if (!readable->SeekForward(chunk_header->Size))
179 return false; // EOF or error.
180 }
181}
182
183bool ReadFmtChunkData(FmtPcmSubchunk* fmt_subchunk, WavHeaderReader* readable) {
184 // Reads "fmt " chunk payload.
185 if (readable->Read(&(fmt_subchunk->AudioFormat), kFmtPcmSubchunkSize) !=
186 kFmtPcmSubchunkSize)
187 return false;
188 const uint32_t fmt_size = fmt_subchunk->header.Size;
189 if (fmt_size != kFmtPcmSubchunkSize) {
190 // There is an optional two-byte extension field permitted to be present
191 // with PCM, but which must be zero.
192 int16_t ext_size;
193 if (kFmtPcmSubchunkSize + sizeof(ext_size) != fmt_size)
194 return false;
195 if (readable->Read(&ext_size, sizeof(ext_size)) != sizeof(ext_size))
196 return false;
197 if (ext_size != 0)
198 return false;
199 }
200 return true;
201}
202
203void WritePcmWavHeader(size_t num_channels,
204 int sample_rate,
205 size_t bytes_per_sample,
206 size_t num_samples,
207 uint8_t* buf,
208 size_t* header_size) {
209 RTC_CHECK(buf);
210 RTC_CHECK(header_size);
211 *header_size = kPcmWavHeaderSize;
212 auto header = rtc::MsanUninitialized<WavHeaderPcm>({});
213 const size_t bytes_in_payload = bytes_per_sample * num_samples;
214
215 header.riff.header.ID = PackFourCC('R', 'I', 'F', 'F');
216 header.riff.header.Size = RiffChunkSize(bytes_in_payload, *header_size);
217 header.riff.Format = PackFourCC('W', 'A', 'V', 'E');
218 header.fmt.header.ID = PackFourCC('f', 'm', 't', ' ');
219 header.fmt.header.Size = kFmtPcmSubchunkSize;
220 header.fmt.AudioFormat = MapWavFormatToHeaderField(WavFormat::kWavFormatPcm);
221 header.fmt.NumChannels = static_cast<uint16_t>(num_channels);
222 header.fmt.SampleRate = sample_rate;
223 header.fmt.ByteRate = ByteRate(num_channels, sample_rate, bytes_per_sample);
224 header.fmt.BlockAlign = BlockAlign(num_channels, bytes_per_sample);
225 header.fmt.BitsPerSample = static_cast<uint16_t>(8 * bytes_per_sample);
226 header.data.header.ID = PackFourCC('d', 'a', 't', 'a');
227 header.data.header.Size = static_cast<uint32_t>(bytes_in_payload);
228
229 // Do an extra copy rather than writing everything to buf directly, since buf
230 // might not be correctly aligned.
231 memcpy(buf, &header, *header_size);
232}
233
234void WriteIeeeFloatWavHeader(size_t num_channels,
235 int sample_rate,
236 size_t bytes_per_sample,
237 size_t num_samples,
238 uint8_t* buf,
239 size_t* header_size) {
240 RTC_CHECK(buf);
241 RTC_CHECK(header_size);
242 *header_size = kIeeeFloatWavHeaderSize;
243 auto header = rtc::MsanUninitialized<WavHeaderIeeeFloat>({});
244 const size_t bytes_in_payload = bytes_per_sample * num_samples;
245
246 header.riff.header.ID = PackFourCC('R', 'I', 'F', 'F');
247 header.riff.header.Size = RiffChunkSize(bytes_in_payload, *header_size);
248 header.riff.Format = PackFourCC('W', 'A', 'V', 'E');
249 header.fmt.header.ID = PackFourCC('f', 'm', 't', ' ');
250 header.fmt.header.Size = kFmtIeeeFloatSubchunkSize;
251 header.fmt.AudioFormat =
252 MapWavFormatToHeaderField(WavFormat::kWavFormatIeeeFloat);
253 header.fmt.NumChannels = static_cast<uint16_t>(num_channels);
254 header.fmt.SampleRate = sample_rate;
255 header.fmt.ByteRate = ByteRate(num_channels, sample_rate, bytes_per_sample);
256 header.fmt.BlockAlign = BlockAlign(num_channels, bytes_per_sample);
257 header.fmt.BitsPerSample = static_cast<uint16_t>(8 * bytes_per_sample);
258 header.fmt.ExtensionSize = 0;
259 header.fact.header.ID = PackFourCC('f', 'a', 'c', 't');
260 header.fact.header.Size = 4;
261 header.fact.SampleLength = static_cast<uint32_t>(num_channels * num_samples);
262 header.data.header.ID = PackFourCC('d', 'a', 't', 'a');
263 header.data.header.Size = static_cast<uint32_t>(bytes_in_payload);
264
265 // Do an extra copy rather than writing everything to buf directly, since buf
266 // might not be correctly aligned.
267 memcpy(buf, &header, *header_size);
268}
269
270// Returns the number of bytes per sample for the format.
271size_t GetFormatBytesPerSample(WavFormat format) {
272 switch (format) {
273 case WavFormat::kWavFormatPcm:
274 // Other values may be OK, but for now we're conservative.
275 return 2;
276 case WavFormat::kWavFormatALaw:
277 case WavFormat::kWavFormatMuLaw:
278 return 1;
279 case WavFormat::kWavFormatIeeeFloat:
280 return 4;
281 }
282 RTC_CHECK_NOTREACHED();
283}
284
285bool CheckWavParameters(size_t num_channels,
286 int sample_rate,
287 WavFormat format,
288 size_t bytes_per_sample,
289 size_t num_samples) {
290 // num_channels, sample_rate, and bytes_per_sample must be positive, must fit
291 // in their respective fields, and their product must fit in the 32-bit
292 // ByteRate field.
293 if (num_channels == 0 || sample_rate <= 0 || bytes_per_sample == 0)
294 return false;
295 if (static_cast<uint64_t>(sample_rate) > std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max())
296 return false;
297 if (num_channels > std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max())
298 return false;
299 if (static_cast<uint64_t>(bytes_per_sample) * 8 >
300 std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max())
301 return false;
302 if (static_cast<uint64_t>(sample_rate) * num_channels * bytes_per_sample >
303 std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max())
304 return false;
305
306 // format and bytes_per_sample must agree.
307 switch (format) {
308 case WavFormat::kWavFormatPcm:
309 // Other values may be OK, but for now we're conservative:
310 if (bytes_per_sample != 1 && bytes_per_sample != 2)
311 return false;
312 break;
313 case WavFormat::kWavFormatALaw:
314 case WavFormat::kWavFormatMuLaw:
315 if (bytes_per_sample != 1)
316 return false;
317 break;
318 case WavFormat::kWavFormatIeeeFloat:
319 if (bytes_per_sample != 4)
320 return false;
321 break;
322 default:
323 return false;
324 }
325
326 // The number of bytes in the file, not counting the first ChunkHeader, must
327 // be less than 2^32; otherwise, the ChunkSize field overflows.
328 const size_t header_size = kPcmWavHeaderSize - sizeof(ChunkHeader);
329 const size_t max_samples =
330 (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max() - header_size) / bytes_per_sample;
331 if (num_samples > max_samples)
332 return false;
333
334 // Each channel must have the same number of samples.
335 if (num_samples % num_channels != 0)
336 return false;
337
338 return true;
339}
340
341} // namespace
342
343bool CheckWavParameters(size_t num_channels,
344 int sample_rate,
345 WavFormat format,
346 size_t num_samples) {
347 return CheckWavParameters(num_channels, sample_rate, format,
348 GetFormatBytesPerSample(format), num_samples);
349}
350
351void WriteWavHeader(size_t num_channels,
352 int sample_rate,
353 WavFormat format,
354 size_t num_samples,
355 uint8_t* buf,
356 size_t* header_size) {
357 RTC_CHECK(buf);
358 RTC_CHECK(header_size);
359
360 const size_t bytes_per_sample = GetFormatBytesPerSample(format);
361 RTC_CHECK(CheckWavParameters(num_channels, sample_rate, format,
362 bytes_per_sample, num_samples));
363 if (format == WavFormat::kWavFormatPcm) {
364 WritePcmWavHeader(num_channels, sample_rate, bytes_per_sample, num_samples,
365 buf, header_size);
366 } else {
367 RTC_CHECK_EQ(format, WavFormat::kWavFormatIeeeFloat);
368 WriteIeeeFloatWavHeader(num_channels, sample_rate, bytes_per_sample,
369 num_samples, buf, header_size);
370 }
371}
372
373bool ReadWavHeader(WavHeaderReader* readable,
374 size_t* num_channels,
375 int* sample_rate,
376 WavFormat* format,
377 size_t* bytes_per_sample,
378 size_t* num_samples,
379 int64_t* data_start_pos) {
380 // Read using the PCM header, even though it might be float Wav file
381 auto header = rtc::MsanUninitialized<WavHeaderPcm>({});
382
383 // Read RIFF chunk.
384 if (readable->Read(&header.riff, sizeof(header.riff)) != sizeof(header.riff))
385 return false;
386 if (ReadFourCC(header.riff.header.ID) != "RIFF")
387 return false;
388 if (ReadFourCC(header.riff.Format) != "WAVE")
389 return false;
390
391 // Find "fmt " and "data" chunks. While the official Wave file specification
392 // does not put requirements on the chunks order, it is uncommon to find the
393 // "data" chunk before the "fmt " one. The code below fails if this is not the
394 // case.
395 if (!FindWaveChunk(&header.fmt.header, readable, "fmt ")) {
396 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "Cannot find 'fmt ' chunk.";
397 return false;
398 }
399 if (!ReadFmtChunkData(&header.fmt, readable)) {
400 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "Cannot read 'fmt ' chunk.";
401 return false;
402 }
403 if (!FindWaveChunk(&header.data.header, readable, "data")) {
404 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "Cannot find 'data' chunk.";
405 return false;
406 }
407
408 // Parse needed fields.
409 *format = MapHeaderFieldToWavFormat(header.fmt.AudioFormat);
410 *num_channels = header.fmt.NumChannels;
411 *sample_rate = header.fmt.SampleRate;
412 *bytes_per_sample = header.fmt.BitsPerSample / 8;
413 const size_t bytes_in_payload = header.data.header.Size;
414 if (*bytes_per_sample == 0)
415 return false;
416 *num_samples = bytes_in_payload / *bytes_per_sample;
417
418 const size_t header_size = *format == WavFormat::kWavFormatPcm
419 ? kPcmWavHeaderSize
420 : kIeeeFloatWavHeaderSize;
421
422 if (header.riff.header.Size < RiffChunkSize(bytes_in_payload, header_size))
423 return false;
424 if (header.fmt.ByteRate !=
425 ByteRate(*num_channels, *sample_rate, *bytes_per_sample))
426 return false;
427 if (header.fmt.BlockAlign != BlockAlign(*num_channels, *bytes_per_sample))
428 return false;
429
430 if (!CheckWavParameters(*num_channels, *sample_rate, *format,
431 *bytes_per_sample, *num_samples)) {
432 return false;
433 }
434
435 *data_start_pos = readable->GetPosition();
436 return true;
437}
438
